name: Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program
description: Temporary food assistance for eligible low-income families and individuals is available from the U.S. Department of Agriculture

name: Women, Infants & Children
description: A federally-funded Special Supplemental Nutrition Program of the Food and Nutrition Service of the United States Department of Agriculture and is administered by the Michigan Department of Health and Human Services, serving low and moderate income pregnant, breastfeeding, and postpartum women, infants, and children up to age five who are found to be at nutritional risk.
requirements: Visit provider website and click the 'Am I Eligible' button

name: Congregate and Carry Out Meals
provider: Menominee Delta Schoolcraft Community Action Agency
description: A food assistance program offered by the Senior Services division of MDSCAA for seniors who are otherwise unable to prepare or afford nutritious meals.
requirements: Must be at least 60 years of age
Must fill out annual registration form

name: Commodity Supplemental Food Program
provider: Menominee Delta Schoolcraft Community Action Agency
description: The Commodity Supplemental Food Program is a program that is designed to supplement the nutritional needs of individuals over 60 years of age.
requirements: Must be at least 60 years of age
See provider website for income eligibility requirements

name: Commodity Supplemental Food Program - DICSA
description: The Commodity Supplemental Food Program is a program that is designed to supplement the nutritional needs of individuals over 60 years of age.
requirements: Must be at least 60 years of age
See provider website for income eligibility requirements

description: The Commodity Supplemental Food Program is a program that is designed to supplement the nutritional needs of individuals over 60 years of age.
